intro: Siphocampylus elegans var. boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian elegant siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
